EmailTemplate.subject: Hot off the press: Download your free copy of Nate Schutta's book today
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
As summer gets underway, you may find yourself with extra reading time on your hands. Based on what your colleagues at Cognizant have been reading and watching, we’ve found a new author whose latest book and blog series should be at the top of your reading list: Nathaniel (Nate) T. Schutta.
Nate Schutta is a software architect focused on cloud computing and building usable applications. A proponent of polyglot programming, Nate has written multiple books and appeared in several videos. He is a seasoned speaker who regularly presents around the world at conferences, No Fluff Just Stuff symposia, meetups, universities, and user groups.
Recommended for your summer reading list: Thinking Architecturally: Lead Technical Change Within Your Engineering Team <[[https://content.pivotal.io/ebooks/thinking-architecturally?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]>
In Nate’s new eBook, you will learn how to evaluate new technologies and frameworks to decide if they’re right for your project. The book is written in a very approachable manner, targeting everyone from junior developers to tech leads and senior architects.
For more by Nate Schutta, check out his popular blog series, Should that be a Microservice? Part 1 <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/should-that-be-a-microservice-keep-these-six-factors-in-mind?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]>, Part 2 <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/should-that-be-a-microservice-part-2-multiple-rates-of-change?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]>, Part 3 <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/should-that-be-a-microservice-part-3-independent-life-cycles?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]>, and Part 4 <[[https://content.pivotal.io/blog/should-that-be-a-microservice-part-4-independent-scalability?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]>.
And if you'd like to know more about what else your colleagues at Cognizant are reading and watching, take a look at the Top 10 resources <[[https://content.pivotal.io/cognizant-pivotal?utm_source=email&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=partner-news-cognizant&utm_term=q218]]> consumed by your Cognizant peers.
Please don’t hesitate to reach out directly if you have any questions on our joint collaboration, or if there’s anything else you’d like to see on this list!
Warmly, Alexis Kane Director, Pivotal
